links.title: Market Wrap March 1, 2018
links.description: Thursday marked the third distribution day in a row for the Nasdaq and the S&P 500. The market uptrend is now under pressure, which means investors must be more cautious. The market was negative and sold off in February with sharp action. I would rather have seen a more controlled descent.

links.title: 3_02_18 - Market Analysis - Another down day with some hope
links.description: Market Analysis - Another down day with some hope. The markets bossed moderately off of the 100 SMA. Although the $VXX was up, it wasn't nearly as high as the big drop back from 2/5. At this time, I think there's still more downside, but not so sure we will get back to the lows on 2/9.

links.title: Tesla's Sales Might Be on Fire Right Now
links.description: Tesla's sales may be electrified right now. Detroit's 'Big 3' automakers each experienced a decline in sales in February when compared to the same month last year, but Tesla Inc. ( TSLA) may have bucked that trend. Tesla's sales surged 76% in February over the previous year, according to data from insideevs.com.

links.title: Boom in Share Buybacks Renews Question of Who Wins From Tax Cuts
links.description: U.S. companies are buying back their shares at an aggressive pace, stirring debates in Washington and on Wall Street about how savings from corporate tax cuts are being used and who benefits most.
